title: How to Collaborate on Screenshots With CollabShot

steps.headline: Go to CollabShot.com and download the appropriate version.
steps.description: It comes in Linux, Mac and Windows flavors.

steps.headline: Double click on the EXE file and install it.
steps.description: Since it isn't zipped, you won't need an unzip program for it. If you have a section where you keep graphics type of programs, be sure to change the path.

steps.headline: Click on the CollabShot icon to start up the program.
To start your paste, be sure you are on the appropriate page and hit CTRL + ALT + P. This will bring you to the screen displayed in the screenshot.
Use the guidelines on the screen to make your selection and make it.
Wait a few seconds (depending on your connection) for it to upload.
Share the link.
steps.description: It automatically pastes the screenshot URL onto your clipboard, so all you have to do is CTRL V.

steps.headline: Go to the site and view your screenshot.
steps.description:
In the upper right corner of the screen, you will see some editing tools. From left to right, they are:
Pencil tool
Line Tool (you will need to draw the arrow)
Rectangle
Ellipse
Note
Undo
Clear All
The tools are pretty self explanatory except for the Notes.

steps.headline: Add a note if needed.
steps.description: Click on the Note icon. In the upper left part of your screenshot, you will see a little space that says "double click to edit". Double click in there and write your note. After completing the note, click on the check mark. Move it wherever needed.

text:
Go to CollabShot.com and download the appropriate version. It comes in Linux, Mac and Windows flavors. Double click on the EXE file and install it. Since it isn't zipped, you won't need an unzip program for it. If you have a section where you keep graphics type of programs, be sure to change the path. Click on the CollabShot icon to start up the program.  To start your paste, be sure you are on the appropriate page and hit CTRL + ALT + P. This will bring you to the screen displayed in the screenshot.  Use the guidelines on the screen to make your selection and make it.  Wait a few seconds (depending on your connection) for it to upload. It does it automatically. Share the link. It automatically pastes the screenshot URL onto your clipboard, so all you have to do is CTRL V. Go to the site and view your screenshot. In the upper right corner of the screen, you will see some editing tools. From left to right, they are:
Pencil tool
Line Tool (you will need to draw the arrow)
Rectangle
Ellipse
Note
Undo
Clear All
The tools are pretty self explanatory except for the Notes. Add a note if needed. Click on the Note icon. In the upper left part of your screenshot, you will see a little space that says "double click to edit". Double click in there and write your note. After completing the note, click on the check mark. Move it wherever needed. Finished.
